headline: Santa Claus Deserted the Market. It’s Still Been a Good Year for Stocks.
summary: Investors are still sitting on a more than 25% gain for the year, and it’s arguable that the frenzied postelection bump pulled forward some of December’s typical gains. Nonetheless, the month’s anemic showing is atypical.

headline: AI stock trade goes beyond Mag 7 in 2025
summary: While the increase in AI enthusiasm in 2025 is expected to drive even more growth for the "Magnificent Seven," which comprises Amazon (AMZN), Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Meta (META), Nvidia (NVDA), Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), and Tesla (TSLA), equity strategists also predict the AI buzz will extend to other sectors in the S&P 500 (^GSPC) next year. Yahoo Finance's Josh Schafer joins Market Domination to share his outlook for AI's expansion in 2025. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Josh Lynch

headline: Winners of the tech sector in 2024
summary: It was the year of artificial intelligence (AI) in the tech sector. Yahoo Finance's Akiko Fujita appears on Catalysts to discuss companies that saw big rewards for their technology investments. Nvidia (NVDA) led tech industry stocks in 2024 with a near 174% jump year to date, ignited by strong demand for Blackwell, the company's advanced graphics processing unit. Broadcom (AVGO) closely followed Nvidia, surpassing the $1 trillion market cap for the first time thanks to AI chips. Oracle (ORCL) made a comeback this year, jumping nearly 60%, due to its cloud infrastructure technology and new partnerships with OpenAI and Meta (META). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Josh Lynch

headline: NYT Report Says Jensen Huang, The CEO Of Nvidia And The 10th-Richest Person In The U.S., Trying To Allegedly Avoid $8 Billion In Taxes
summary: Jensen Huang, the CEO and cofounder of Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), is making headlines for more than just his company's dominance in AI chips. Huang is allegedly leveraging legal tax strategies to protect an estimated $8 billion from federal estate and gift taxes, according to a recent investigation by The New York Times. headline: Nvidia Can't Hold Key Level After China AI Startup Shock; Is Nvidia A Sell Now?
summary: Nvidia could not hold a key level on Friday.  Does that mean Nvidia is a buy or sell now?  Chinese AI startup DeepSeek trained its AI model using Nvidia's chips with capabilities matching the models made by startups in the U.S., such as Microsoft-backed OpenAI, and Anthropic, in which Amazon.com has a stake.
